title: Describe distribution of running time difference

content.question: Which of the following is true about the distribution of <math alttext="X minus Y" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>X</mi> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mi>Y</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ?

choices.label: The variables <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are independent; therefore, the mean is <math alttext="34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds and the standard deviation is <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds.

The variables <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are independent; therefore, the mean is <math alttext="34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds and the standard deviation is <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds.

The variables <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are not independent; therefore, the standard deviation is <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds and the mean cannot be determined with the information given.

The variables <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are not independent; therefore, the mean is <math alttext="34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds and the standard deviation cannot be determined with the information given.

The variables <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are not independent; therefore, neither the mean nor the standard deviation can be determined with the information given.

content.answer: The variables <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are not independent; therefore, the mean is <math alttext="34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds and the standard deviation cannot be determined with the information given.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
